alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 19 at 12:00PM CST until January 19 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Winter Storm Impacts Diminishing... .Overall, weather is on the decrease across the Upper Mississippi Valley and roads are improving in most areas. Snow accumulations of 4 to 9 inches have been reported through late morning, with the exception of southwest Wisconsin and adjacent northeast Iowa where 1-4 inches fell. Snow and occasional freezing drizzle is falling through northcentral Wisconsin into southeast Minnesota north of I-90. Some slick spots remain there, but a majority of the main roads are only wet and travel impacts are decreasing. Road conditions are expected to continue to improve through the day with temperatures near freezing making road treatments effective. Weather warnings could be canceled early. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Light snow and freezing drizzle. Little accumulation is expected during the afternoon. * WHERE...Taylor and Clark Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
